feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [ezyang/htmlpurifier] HTML Purifier allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information
entry.content:
HTML Purifier 4.2.0 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a direct request to a .php file, which reveals the installation path in an error message, as demonstrated by tests/PHPT/Reporter/SimpleTest.php and certain other files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-3744
  • http://code.google.com/p/inspathx/source/browse/trunk/paths_vuln/%21_README
  • http://code.google.com/p/inspathx/source/browse/trunk/paths_vuln/htmlpurifier-4.2.0
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/06/27/6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jw86-5cjf-mv79

entry.title: [ezyang/htmlpurifier] HTML Purifier Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in smoketests/configForm.php in HTML Purifier before 2.0.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors related to "unescaped print_r output."

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-3498
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/35300
  • http://htmlpurifier.org/svnroot/htmlpurifier/tags/2.0.1/NEWS
  • https://github.com/ezyang/htmlpurifier/commit/96b571d23639bd70768b8db626ecaf8bbb7ca5a3
  • https://github.com/ezyang/htmlpurifier/commits/v2.0.1/smoketests/configForm.php
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200228110020/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/24699
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6fh7-fwqj-mv49

entry.title: [ameos/ameos_tarteaucitron] Cross site scripting in ameos_tarteaucitron
entry.content:
The ameos_tarteaucitron (aka AMEOS - TarteAuCitron GDPR cookie banner and tracking management / French RGPD compatible) extension before 1.2.23 for TYPO3 allows XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-33155
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2022-013
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4vr9-33fv-mg6r

entry.title: [funadmin/funadmin] Funadmin Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
An issue was found in funadmin 5.0.2. The selectfiles method in \backend\controller\sys\Attachh.php directly stores the passed parameters and values into the param parameter without filtering, resulting in Cross Site Scripting (XSS).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48228
  • https://github.com/funadmin/funadmin/issues/31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j9wp-x5q5-xh2f

entry.title: [funadmin/funadmin] Logic flaw in Funadmin
entry.content:
Funadmin 5.0.2 has a logical flaw in the Curd one click command deletion function, which can result in a Denial of Service (DOS).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48227
  • https://github.com/funadmin/funadmin/issues/27
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r9v5-q97m-rj5g

entry.title: [funadmin/funadmin] SQL injection in funadmin
entry.content:
funadmin 5.0.2 is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the parentField parameter in the index method of \backend\controller\auth\Auth.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48230
  • https://github.com/funadmin/funadmin/issues/30
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2mv8-jjm5-f3hr

entry.title: [funadmin/funadmin] SQL injection in funadmin
entry.content:
funadmin 5.0.2 has a SQL injection vulnerability in the Curd one click command mode plugin.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48229
  • https://github.com/funadmin/funadmin/issues/28
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h345-r48x-g68f

entry.content:
Funadmin 5.0.2 is vulnerable to SQL Injection in curd/table/savefield.

entry.title: [funadmin/funadmin] SQL injection in funadmin
entry.content:
Funadmin v5.0.2 has an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability in /curd/index/delfile.

entry.title: [maestroerror/php-heic-to-jpg] Remote code execution in php-heic-to-jpg
entry.content:
php-heic-to-jpg <= 1.0.5 is vulnerable to remote code execution. An attacker who can upload heic images is able to execute code on the remote server via the file name. As a result, the CIA is no longer guaranteed. This affects php-heic-to-jpg 1.0.5 and below.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-48514
  • https://github.com/MaestroError/php-heic-to-jpg
  • https://github.com/marcoris/CVEs/tree/master/CVE-2024-48514
  • https://github.com/MaestroError/php-heic-to-jpg/pull/34
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g8v9-c8m3-942v

entry.title: [pterodactyl/panel] Pterodactyl Panel has plain-text logging of user passwords when two-factor authentication is disabled
entry.content:
Impact

When a user disables two-factor authentication via the Panel, a DELETE request with their current password in a query parameter will be sent. While query parameters are encrypted when using TLS, many webservers (including ones officially documented for use with Pterodactyl) will log query parameters in plain-text, storing a user's password in plain text.

If a malicious user obtains access to these logs they could potentially authenticate against a user's account; assuming they are able to discover the account's email address or username separately.

Patches

This problem has been patched by https://github.com/pterodactyl/panel/commit/8be2b892c3940bdc0157ccdab16685a72d105dd1 on the 1.0-develop branch and released under v1.11.8 as a single commit on top of v1.11.7 https://github.com/pterodactyl/panel/commit/75b59080e2812ced677dab516222b2a3bb34e3a4

Patch file: https://github.com/pterodactyl/panel/commit/8be2b892c3940bdc0157ccdab16685a72d105dd1.patch

Workarounds

There are no workarounds at this time. There is not a direct vulnerability within the software as it relates to logs generated by intermediate components such as webservers or Layer 7 proxies.

Updating to v1.11.8 or adding the linked patch manually are the only ways to avoid this problem.

User Notice

As this vulnerability relates to historical logging of sensitive data, users who have ever disabled 2FA on a Panel (self-hosted or operated by a company) should change their passwords and consider enabling 2FA if it was left disabled. While it's unlikely that your account will be compromised by this vulnerability, it's not impossible.

Panel administrators should consider clearing any access logs that may contain sensitive data, for Panels using NGINX, the access log is located at /var/log/nginx/pterodactyl.app-access.log.

References

  • https://github.com/pterodactyl/panel/security/advisories/GHSA-c479-wq8g-57hr
  • https://github.com/pterodactyl/panel/commit/75b59080e2812ced677dab516222b2a3bb34e3a4
  • https://github.com/pterodactyl/panel/commit/8be2b892c3940bdc0157ccdab16685a72d105dd1
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-49762
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c479-wq8g-57hr

entry.title: [aimeos/ai-admin-graphql] ai-admin-graphql has a Denial of service vulnerability in SaaS and marketplace setups
entry.content:
All SaaS and marketplace setups using Aimeos version from 2024.04 up to 2024.07.1 are affected by a potential denial of service attack

References

  • https://github.com/aimeos/ai-admin-graphql/security/advisories/GHSA-qxgx-hvg3-v92w
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47173
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qxgx-hvg3-v92w

entry.title: [baserproject/basercms] baserCMS has a Cross-site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in Edit Email Form Settings Feature
entry.content:
XSS vulnerability in Edit Email Form Settings Feature to baserCMS.

Target

baserCMS 5.1.1 and earlier versions

Vulnerability

Malicious code may be executed in Edit Email Form Settings feature.

Countermeasures

Update to the latest version of baserCMS

Please refer to the following page to reference for more information. https://basercms.net/security/JVN_00876083

Credits

Ayato Shitomi＠Fore-Z

References

  • https://github.com/baserproject/basercms/security/advisories/GHSA-p3m2-mj3j-j49x
  • https://basercms.net/security/JVN_00876083
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-46998
  • https://basercms.net/security/JVN_98693329
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p3m2-mj3j-j49x
